text:
Hello everyone and thank you in advance for creating betfairlightweight, it is magnificent!
I would like to know if anyone is interested in giving me the budget for the work to create this function (I wasn't able to create it):

I need a `place_orders()` where I define the maximum value that should be used from my Betfair account, I define the `runner_id` and the function takes the value and invests it in `Back` immediately at the best odds that have values waiting to be matched on the market, if everything had matches and have stake left over, continue going down the ladder and invest at the odds below until there is nothing left of the desired value.

elements.text:
Hello everyone and thank you in advance for creating betfairlightweight, it is magnificent!
I would like to know if anyone is interested in giving me the budget for the work to create this function (I wasn't able to create it):

I need a
place_orders()
where I define the maximum value that should be used from my Betfair account, I define the
runner_id
and the function takes the value and invests it in
Back

immediately at the best odds that have values waiting to be matched on the market, if everything had matches and have stake left over, continue going down the ladder and invest at the odds below until there is nothing left of the desired value.

text: If by chance anyone has this function already created for personal use and would like to share it free of charge, I would also greatly appreciate the help!

elements.text: If by chance anyone has this function already created for personal use and would like to share it free of charge, I would also greatly appreciate the help!

text:
You just want to fire in a back market order, set odds to 1.01 and stake to whatever you want your maximum value to be, the exchange will match every offer in price order until your stake is used up, if you sweep the whole market then cancel anything remaining.

Let us know which markets you are going to fire these into :wink:

text: you are asking for something that happens anyway, your money will be matched at the best prices available, working down the ladder to the price you have requested (as Joe has said on the other thread)

elements.text: you are asking for something that happens anyway, your money will be matched at the best prices available, working down the ladder to the price you have requested (as Joe has said on the other thread)

text:
Hi <@U05L8PZD2FM> so do I just do it like this below?

```limit_order = betfairlightweight.filters.limit_order(size=xxxxxx.xx, price=1.01)
instruction = betfairlightweight.filters.place_instruction(
    order_type="LIMIT",
    selection_id=45321,
    side="BACK",
    limit_order=limit_order
)
place_orders = trading.betting.place_orders(
    market_id="1.123456789",
    instructions=[instruction]
)```
And I will do this in Tennis in a specific game scenario only in the third set of women's matches, but I will manually define the runner_id and activate the code, it will not run automatically, if it were I could comment in more detail on what I will do.

And I will do this in Tennis in a specific game scenario only in the third set of women's matches, but I will manually define the runner_id and activate the code, it will not run automatically, if it were I could comment in more detail on what I will do.

text: Can I ask, would you be HAPPY if even a portion of your stake was matched at 1.01 in ALL circumstances? If the answer is no, then it might be an idea to give this approach more thought.

text:
Hi <@UUE6E1LA1> , for this specific scenario that I want to work on and that I will be visually following the game and the market in real time, I will at most be able to make the market move down a few ticks on the ladder, at least for me it is financially impossible to be able to invest so much money in a single investment.

But thank you very much for your concern regarding the risk of wanting to use something as expansive as this, but I will do it in large and medium-sized matches, so the market total values are too high to me alone achieve such strength on the ladder.

text: Hi <@UGV299K6H> It's much better this way because I can automatically record information about all investments in a CSV and create a list of upcoming games by searching for the ID of the athletes I'm interested in and when starting a game I receive a notification on Telegram and the code waits for a `input` of `YES` or `NO`, I watch and if the scenario appears I type YES and execute the investment without need access the entire Betfair website or the Geeks Toy Program.

text: Ok, well in that case just use limit orders as implemented. Take current back price from market, subtract n_ticks per your config and fire away. betfair matching will take care of the rest and you will often get better odds than your true limit price

text: Ok - so you have to remember that you're not the only market participant, there's no guarantee that someone won't clear a few ticks ahead of you, or that some event might move the market whilst you're submitting. However you do it, and whatever the reason you're doing it, you would be well advised to set a back-stop minimum price. Submitting at 1.01 is very rarely the smart move.

elements.text: Ok - so you have to remember that you're not the only market participant, there's no guarantee that someone won't clear a few ticks ahead of you, or that some event might move the market whilst you're submitting. text: <@U06Q3ASP1FU> the feature you are needing is called 'best price execution', available in every limit order book, here is a very badly written explanation: <https://support.betfair.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/404/>

elements.text: the feature you are needing is called 'best price execution', available in every limit order book, here is a very badly written explanation:

text:
Ok so I imagine there's probably a function in betfair util (or whatever it's called - search this forum) that subtracts X ticks from a price, and if there isn't then just get an ordered list of all the odds increments and move X increments along from batb price.

Be warned though - IP tennis is very competitive with some super sophisticated players, that doesn't mean it's impossible, but if your analysis is relatively rudimentary then it's much more likely that you're missing something than that they are.

elements.text:
Ok so I imagine there's probably a function in betfair util (or whatever it's called - search this forum) that subtracts X ticks from a price, and if there isn't then just get an ordered list of all the odds increments and move X increments along from batb price.

Be warned though - IP tennis is very competitive with some super sophisticated players, that doesn't mean it's impossible, but if your analysis is relatively rudimentary then it's much more likely that you're missing something than that they are.

text: <@U06Q3ASP1FU> If you just want reliable bet recording, you can still place the bets manually, and you can run a script to hit the Betfair “listClearedOrders” endpoint which will give you the details of all the bets you had matched.

elements.text: If you just want reliable bet recording, you can still place the bets manually, and you can run a script to hit the Betfair “listClearedOrders” endpoint which will give you the details of all the bets you had matched.
